question_text: Why can’t DDR4 modules be installed in a DDR3 motherboard even though they look similar?
answer_options: DDR4 modules require active cooling not found in DDR3 systems
Keying notches on the memory and slot prevent physical insertion
They can be installed, but won’t operate at full speed
correct_answer: Keying notches on the memory and slot prevent physical insertion
explanation: Each DDR generation has unique physical key notches that prevent installing incompatible modules in the wrong motherboard, thus avoiding electrical mismatch or damage.
